$interpreted: Ned: So you still can't find the token you want to give me?
Lisa: I'm sorry. My new home is too big, and I can't remember where I put it. I'll look for it again when I go back...
Ned: It's ok. You'll definitely find it someday. No need to panic.
Lisa: If that's the case, you don't have to visit my father in person. You know very well that he hates you...
Ned: No good. If we are getting married, I have to let him be at ease and entrust you to me.
Lisa: Alright...

Ned: Pardon my intrusion, Sir Sherlock. 
I'm Ned Garcia Alznar.

Sherlock: Tch, not even a single scratch...
Those thugs are useless...
Lisa: Father, shouldn't you at least say hello?
Sherlock: Hmph. I am the Vice President of the Commerce Chamber. I don't have the time to greet every single customer that shows up at my booth.

Ned: Sir Sherlock, you've misunderstood.
I'm no customer. I'm here to present my marriage proposal.
Sherlock: Who's going to accept your proposal, idiot.
Ned: Sir Sherlock, the target of my proposal is Lisa, not Sir. Therefore, you don't have to accept my proposal...

Sherlock: Do you think I'm that dumb!
I'm saying you have no right to marry my daughter!
Lisa: Father!
Sherlock: If you want me to say yes, fulfill the Poleva Desert tradition first.
Sherlock: Hold on to my daughter's most treasured Rainbow Roses for a month, and then we can talk!
Lisa: I know that. The moment I find it, I will immediately give it to Ned for him to hold onto!
Sherlock: So you haven't found it yet? Then you are wasting your time! Leave now; you're interrupting my business.
Ned: ... Understood. We will take our leave.
Emily: Oh my~ Lisa, is that you?
Lisa: Emily! It's been quite a while!
Emily: It's your fault; you've been so engrossed in your dates with Ned~ By the way, are you two officially engaged now?

Lisa: Not yet...
I just can't find my most treasured Rainbow Roses.
Emily: I was kind of expecting that...
Lisa: Expecting... what do you mean?
Emily: A while ago, I saw Mister Sherlock sneaking around with the Rainbow Roses before heading towards the Hazardous Zone in the desert.
Emily: I was wondering what the heck he was up to back then...
Lisa: So it was father who hid it there? Damnit!
Ned: The Hazardous Zone, is it? I'll go reclaim it for you.

Lisa: I, it's fine.
We can find another item to use as a token.
Ned: I won't allow it. The exchanged token must be the most treasured item of your partner. If not, the ritual will lose its meaning.

Ned: Rest assured, let me take care of this issue.
I will try my hardest to let Sir Sherlock acknowledge me.
Lisa: Ok... be careful.
Ned: Out of my way!
Ned: ... So you want to do it the hard way? Then don't blame me for this!
Ned: Got it. Now I just have to hold on to it for a month.
